title: Amy Duggar of TLC fame welcomes first child with spouse as 'both mom and baby are great and healthy'
text:
Amy Duggar and husband Dillon King welcomed baby son Daxton Ryan King on Wednesday, with the new mom saying, 'He's absolute perfection!!!'

Daxton Ryan weighed 7 lbs., 8 oz., according to People, in the C-section birth, and measured at 20 inches in what the couple's photographer Loren Bullard dubbed a 'smooth and easy delivery.'

The 32-year-old TV personality and her child are great and healthy, Bullard told the magazine.

Fantastic news: Amy Duggar, 32, and husband Dillon King welcomed baby son Daxton Ryan King on Wednesday, with the new mom saying, 'He's absolute perfection!!!'

Amy also shared a shot from the delivery room on Instagram Stories, writing, 'Here we go,' accompanied by an emoji of a blue heart.

Duggar took to the site earlier Wednesday with a shot of herself and King, writing, 'Brb.. we're gonna go be parents now!!'

She said her doctor advised her there was 'an 85% chance' of 'an emergency situation,' so she and King decided upon 'a cesarean to be on the safe side.'

Duggar said that while she expected some negativity to her decision, she's settled upon 'what's right for [her] body and what's healthy for [her] son.'

Overjoyed: Duggar took to the site earlier Wednesday with a shot of herself and King, writing, 'Brb.. we're gonna go be parents now!!'

Glitzy: The duo was snapped in Beverly Hills last December at an event

She added: 'I'm trying to relax, and not worry! But I've never had surgery before, I've never even stayed in a hospital before, so I'm just a ball of nerves.'

Her cousin Anna replied to the post, writing, 'Praying for a safe delivery and quick recovery! You are such an amazing momma already and I can't wait to meet precious baby Dax!'

The couple, who tied the knot four years ago, revealed they were expecting this past April, with Amy telling the publication in June she's 'always wanted' to have a son.

'Dillon builds lifted trucks, so I can just imagine how suped-up the Power Wheels will be,' Duggar said. 'We just can't wait for this little ball of energy to arrive! He's already named, so let all the embroidery begin. I am so obsessed with baby bath robes!'

Speaking with the outlet in August, Amy explained how she and King decided upon naming their son Daxton.

'On the King side of the family, all the letters begin with the letter D. So we were trying to figure out a 'D' name that was different, and we landed on Dax, then Daxton. And then Ryan stands for "Little King," so it was like, we have to!'
description: The couple, who tied the knot four years ago, revealed they were expecting this past April, with Amy telling the publication in June she's 'always wanted' to have a son.
